articles.title: Greetings to Captains Regent of San Marino
articles.content:
Greetings to Captains Regent of San Marino
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Andrea Belluzzi and Roberto Venturini, captains regent of the Republic of San Marino, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message wished the people of San Marino progress and prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Construction Site of Sci-Tech Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Construction Site of Sci-Tech Complex
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made field survey of the construction of the Sci-Tech Complex.
					 He encouraged the soldier-builders working miracles and innovations.
					
					 A consultative meeting held on the spot took a measure for fully ensuring the quality of construction on the principle of taking responsibility for the safety of the project and guarantee its absolute quality for eternity as it is one more monumental edifice to be presented to the Workers' Party of Korea on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of its founding. It also called on the relevant units to satisfactorily supply building materials.
					
					 Earlier, the premier went round the Kumsong Tractor Factory and the Pyongyang Catfish Farm.
					
					 He underscored the position and importance of the factory in realizing the comprehensive mechanization of agriculture and discussed the issues arising in producing highly efficient tractors.
					
					 He also underlined the need to successfully remodel the catfish farm to convey the party's loving care for the people.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Choummaly Saynasone, president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic, on September 2.
					 The message said:
					
					 I, on behalf of the Central Committee of the People's Revolutionary Party, government and people of Laos and on my own behalf, extend warm congratulations and wishes to you, the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, government and people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 67th birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 I am pleased with such great successes in the DPRK as the steady strengthening of the defence capability, the modern development of the country's science and daily improvement of the people's life over the past 67 years under the tested leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 I am firmly convinced that the DPRK would develop into a prosperous socialist state under your wise leadership.
					
					 I regard it as a great pride that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries have been developed on to a new higher stage, bringing substantial interests to the two peoples and making an important contribution to developing the regional and global peace, stability and cooperation.
					
					 I wish you good health and greater success in your noble work on this auspicious and historic occasion. 
					
					 And I hope that the Korean people would win a new victory in accomplishing the cause for defending and constructing the socialist state and the cause for the peaceful reunification of Korea would be achieved at an early date.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Back Home
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation headed by Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday returned home after taking part in celebrations marking the 70th anniversary of the victory in the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and the World Anti-Fascist War held in China.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for South Africa
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for South Africa
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection of the DPRK led by Minister Kim Kyong Jun left here on Thursday to participate in the 14th World Forestry Congress to be held in Durban, South Africa.

articles.title: GFTUK Delegation Leaves for Vietnam, Laos
articles.content:
GFTUK Delegation Leaves for Vietnam, Laos
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) headed by Kim Tong Son, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, left here on Thursday to visit Vietnam and Laos.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Palestinian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas on the occasion of the 67th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The floral basket was handed over to DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong by Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK, Thursday.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Diplomatic Corps Here
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Diplomatic Corps Here
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the 67th birthday of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 They were handed over to DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong by Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK who is doyen of the diplomatic corps, and Roberto Colin, Brazilian Ambassador to the DPRK, on Thursday.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the economic and commercial councilors corps and the UNICEF mission here visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Thursday on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 They laid floral baskets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps Visits Kyongsang Kindergarten
articles.content:
Economic and Commercial Councilors Corps Visits Kyongsang Kindergarten
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors corps here visited Kyongsang Kindergarten on Thursday on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 The guests laid bouquets before a painting portraying President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and made a bow.
					
					 Being briefed on the fact that children are growing to be kings of the country, they went round various places of the kindergarten and enjoyed an art performance given by children.

articles.title: New Poster Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
New Poster Produced in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House has produced a new poster to mark the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Seen in the upper part of the poster are letters reading "1945-2015." It depicts against the background of the blue sky of October the Monument to Party Founding and the flag of the WPK conveying for all ages the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed in the Juche-oriented party building and demonstrating the greatness and invincibility of the WPK which set a world-wide model in the accomplishment of the cause of independence.
					
					 The poster depicts the revolutionary enthusiasm of all service personnel and people to mark the founding anniversary of the WPK as a great revolutionary event to be specially recorded in the Korean nation's history.

articles.title: Stamps Showing History of Sea of Gold Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Stamps Showing History of Sea of Gold Issued in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued stamps (one sheet and an individual) showing the country's new history of sea of gold.
					 The sheet carries a photo of smiling supreme leader Kim Jong Un standing in a landing field where fish pour out.
					
					 The individual shows "Tanphung" ships fully loaded with fish.
					
					 The DPRK is now directing much effort to the marine product industry.

articles.title: Scientific Achievements Made in DPRK
articles.content:
Scientific Achievements Made in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has recently made significant achievements conducive to the national economy.
					 The achievements include a new type of coal-dust collector developed by the Global Environmental Information Institute of the Academy.
					
					 There are also a big hydraulic ram and a two-way remote sports information service system, each developed by the Heat Engineering Institute and the Intelligent Information Institute.
					
					 The ram helps supply irrigation and drinking water to rural villages or mountainous areas without using electricity.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Better Tele-education System
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Better Tele-education System
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- A vigorous campaign has been conducted in the DPRK's education field to better the tele-education system.
					 Kim Il Sung University finalized about 1 000 teaching programs and raised the utility rate of facilities for tele-education. As a result, its Tele-education College started its operation with the e-library of the university as a center in April.
					
					 The Tele-education College under Kim Chaek University of Technology established its tele-education system based on mobile communication network. It enriched the content of teaching materials with the latest research findings and built up the high-tech databases.
					
					 Kim Hyong Jik University of Education developed the tele-education aid programs and improved the quality of its tele-education.
					
					 Such tele-education system was also established at other universities and, consequently, officials and employees at more than 1 280 industrial establishments and organs across the country are now enlisted at the tele-education network.

articles.title: Thapje Mineral Water Wins Popularity among Pyongyangites
articles.content:
Thapje Mineral Water Wins Popularity among Pyongyangites
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Beverages, made of Thapje mineral water, are now enjoying popularity among citizens in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK.
					 They include carbonic and lactic acid drinks.
					
					 Thapje mineral water, seven in pH value, contains calcium, manganese, sodium and other mineral matters and microelements.
					
					 The water was confirmed to have a special virtue for such diseases as chronic gastritis and hepatitis, pyelitis, cystitis, arteriosclerosis and fatness.
					
					 This mineral spring is located in Thapje-dong No. 3 in Taedonggang District, Pyongyang.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Keeping Trend of Present Situation Afloat for Improved Inter-Korean Ties
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Keeping Trend of Present Situation Afloat for Improved Inter-Korean Ties
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The north-south high-level urgent contact and the publication of the joint press release helped put under control the dangerous situation leading to imminent arms conflict and settle peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 In order to put the inter-Korean relations on to a new stage of epochal development on the basis of the agreement, it is important, first of all, to keep afloat the trend of the present situation in which the crisis was put on the track of detente with much effort. 
					
					 The north and the south should not further escalate and push the situation into an extreme phase due to any sudden incident. 
					
					 There are still dangerous factors of stemming the trend of the present situation after an opportunity was won with much effort for mending the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 The conservative betes noires are busy spreading wild rumor in a bid to play down the successes of the north-south high-level contact and significance of the joint press release and crying out even for scrapping the agreement. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities sat face to face at the north-south high-level urgent contact and promised to defuse the touch-and-go situation and solve the issues through dialogue. This being a hard reality, they kicked off largest-ever provocative "integrated firepower annihilating drill 2015" against the DPRK in collusion with the U.S., even before the ink on the agreement got dry.
					
					 Urgent issues such as detente and preserving peace and the promotion of cooperation between the north and the south in various fields are awaiting solutions. 
					
					 Their prospects depend on how they keep and operate the atmosphere of the improved inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 Whether the north-south agreement yields good results or ends in an empty paper just like what happened in the past entirely depends on the role of the north- south authorities.

articles.title: Blood Shed by Koreans at Hands of Americans Should Be Avenged with Blood: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Blood Shed by Koreans at Hands of Americans Should Be Avenged with Blood: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. history of aggression against Korea is not just confined to 70 years but has nearly 150 years which started from the intrusion of its ship General Sherman in 1866.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in an article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The above-said history is characterized by the U.S. crimes as it fully revealed the brigandish nature of Yankees and its true colors as sworn enemy of the Korean people from its very beginning.
					
					 The U.S. is, indeed, the source of misfortune as it imposed all disasters and pain upon the Korean people and made the future of the Korean nation gloomy.
					
					 The U.S. remains unchanged in its ambition to dominate the whole of Korea.
					
					 What it seeks is to put Korea under its permanent control and, on this basis, realize its domination over northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 Precisely for this reason it is the only action to force the U.S. to pay for the blood shed by Koreans.
					
					 The U.S. can never escape the fate of ruin in confrontation with the DPRK as evidenced by the miserable end of its ship General Sherman and its defeat in the Korean war in the 1950s and subsequent period.
					
					 The Korean people will fight against the U.S. imperialist aggressors to the last and surely win a great victory with the indomitable will to annihilate the sworn enemy, the article concludes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blames Japan for Denying Its Past Crime-woven History
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blames Japan for Denying Its Past Crime-woven History 
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Of late, the Japanese Foreign Ministry deleted the contents of "profound remorse" and "sincere apology" mentioned by the former prime ministers including Murayama for the past war of aggression ignited by Japan on its website. And the Yokohama City Education Commission decided to introduce the history textbooks embellishing the Japanese imperialists' war of aggression to 146 public schools in the city from next spring.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this is the tacit denial of the history of the past crimes committed by Japan completely following Abe's "statement."
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 A criminal does not admit his crime as he has no intention to repent of his sin but to repeat it.
					
					 It is the ultimate purpose of Japan to become "leader of Asia" at any cost through revival of the "empire" and realization of the dream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere".
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the Japanese reactionaries are using naive youngsters for realizing their sinister ambition.
					
					 Of course, this is not the first time that Japan is teaching the younger generation distorted history.
					
					 From long ago the Japanese reactionaries implanted a wrong outlook on history and ultra-nationalist idea into the minds of young Japanese through distorted history textbooks and publications with right-wing inclination.
					
					 Younger generation of Japan are now growing to be morally deranged people after being educated in militaristic idea according to right guidelines. The Japanese reactionaries are mulling using such deformed youths as shock force in the operation to realize the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere."
					
					 It is the foolish and shameless calculation of the narrow-minded guys on the island that if they do not admit their history of aggression and crimes, they can evade the responsibility for reparation.
					
					 Japan should awake from the nightmare of militarism as early as possible, honestly acknowledge its past crimes and make a sincere apology and adequate reparation for them.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Regime of Spoiling Atmosphere for North-South Reconciliation
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Regime of Spoiling Atmosphere for North-South Reconciliation
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- All Koreans and the international community have followed the situation on the Korean Peninsula since the north-south joint press release was made public.
					 Now that the situation which inched close to a war has reached detente, it is a prerequisite to peace and security on the peninsula and in other parts of Northeast Asia to safely control the hard-won atmosphere for reconciliation.
					
					 However, media, experts and individual politicians in south Korea are keen on twisting the spirit of the joint press release.
					
					 The south Korean regime unhesitatingly asserted that it should not "over-speed" the improvement of its relations with the north, pining hope on it and slackening vigilance.
					
					 A security meeting of Chongwadae called for "putting the lid on over-optimism" as north-south negotiations have not yet come to an end but have just begun.
					
					 A spokesman for the "Ministry of Unification" asserted that there is no need to expect too much from the projected reunion of separated families and relatives from the north and the south as "over-speeding should be banned in the development of north-south relations now that the "May 24 step" has not yet been lifted.
					
					 Notably, Kim Kwan Jin, chief of the security office of Chongwadae, and Hong Yong Phyo, minister of "Unification," who came to the contact, is floating the rumor that as the contact was the "first one that wrested a definite apology from the north" and brought a "stepping stone to ending an evil cycle", the "May 24 step" might be lifted only when the north "makes an apology" for "torpedoing Cheonan warship", takes a measure for preventing its recurrence and punishes those responsible for it.
					
					 Timed to coincide with their assertion, the conservative media in south Korea are busy misleading the public opinion, asserting it is not necessary to pin too much hope on the north-south agreement.
					
					 All these ill-intended outbursts are closely related to the largest-ever "integrated firepower annihilating drill 2015" staged by the south Korean regime in league with the U.S. forces on August 28 shortly after the north-south high-level urgent contact.
					
					 Even a mere child knows that such reckless remarks and military actions provoking the dialogue partner and escalating tensions might chill the atmosphere of the north-south relations and disturb the safe control of the situation.
					
					 All facts make the public become skeptical about whether the south Korean regime is sincere in its efforts to mend the north-south relations or not.
					
					 Improvement of the north-south relations is of weighty significance in the history of the nation as it is directly related to the destiny of all Koreans.
					
					 A mere reckless remark and a simple rash action might adversely affect the situation.
					
					 No one is entitled to violate the north-south agreement which both the north and the south promised to implement before all Koreans.
					
					 Whether the north-south relations are repaired or not totally hinges on with what attitude the north and the south opt for solving problems.
					
					 The north and the south should opt for mending their relations from their honest stand and attitude to reunify the country through cooperation and unity but not chill the atmosphere and deliberately lay obstacles in the way of improving the relations.
					
					 All Koreans should keep strict vigilance against the moves of the forces undesirous of rapid development of the north-south relations and thoroughly smash the sinister acts of inciting confrontation. The north and the south are obliged to properly control the hard-won phase of reconciliation.
					
					 All Koreans and history are watching whether the north-south agreement specified in the joint press release is implemented or not.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Creating Complexity in North-South Relations
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Creating Complexity in North-South Relations
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Thursday as regards the fact that the south Korean chief executive during her foreign trip let loose such disturbing remarks as describing a series of incidents that occurred in the area along the Demilitarized Zone as the "north's provocations" and expressed "thanks for the constructive role" played by someone:
					 All the Koreans are feeling relieved as the serious crisis that could have led to an armed conflict between the north and the south was tided over and they are unanimous in their hope that the joint press release that was agreed at the north-south high-level urgent contact would be fulfilled with sincerity to create a new environment for improving the relations and achieving peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 A Red Cross working contact is slated to take place for the reunions of separated families and relatives in coming September 7th under the north-south agreement and other preparations are also in the making for the improvement of the north-south relations.
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities are repeatedly uttering wild remarks chilling this atmosphere, thereby creating complexity in the north-south relations again.
					
					 The south Korean chief executive who set on her foreign trip on Sept. 2 falsified the truth about the recent situation while talking about "provocation by the north in the DMZ" and asserting "tension might escalate any moment". She went the lengths of mentioning the "constructive role" played by someone, a seriously insult to the DPRK, and sophism devoid of elementary political awareness.
					
					 As unanimously estimated by the public at home and abroad, the DPRK proposed the north-south high-level urgent contact on its own initiative from a transparent independent stand in reflection of the fundamental interests and the desire of the nation and provided a dramatic occasion of achieving peace on the Korean Peninsula and improving the north-south relations with sincere efforts.
					
					 The south Korean chief executive, defying this stark reality, let loose ill words while making eyes at others during her foreign trip. This clearly proves that she pursues north-south confrontation in reliance on someone despite her lip-service to reconciliation and cooperation.
					
					 Ill-boding remarks being heard from her juniors are problematic but what is all the more serious are irresponsible remarks the chief executive is unhesitatingly making in breach of the spirit of the north-south agreement and the trend of the times. These are very serious development making it hard to judge issues high on agenda for repairing the north-south relations.
					
					 In fact, one may say the north-south relations are like thin ice.
					
					 Therefore, the DPRK advised the south Korean authorities to keep and take good control of the north-south ties that were put on the track of reconciliation and detente with much effort and to specially guard against those forces displeased with the process to improve the ties with particular attention.
					
					 If the south Korean chief executive has an elementary political insight, she should be careful about her behavior and words that can turn the tide of the situation against will in such a sensitive time as now.
					
					 She should also clearly remember that the force promoting the improvement of the north-south ties and preserving peace on the peninsula are the Korean nation itself, not outsiders.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities persist in utterances seriously rattling the nerves of the dialogue partner while peddling the internal issue of the nation abroad, the north-south relations cannot but suffer from the repetition of the evil cycle of confrontation.
					
					 Whether the hard-won north-south agreement is substantially implemented to pave the path for improving the relations or not and whether the situation again reaches an extreme phase or not entirely depend on the attitude of the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: Epidemics Spread in South Korean Army
articles.content:
Epidemics Spread in South Korean Army 
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Different kinds of epidemics spread in the south Korean army. 
					 Many officers and soldiers of south Korean army have suffered from tuberculosis, hepatitis, malaria and other epidemics this year and the number is 2.4 times bigger than that in 2012, according to the south Korean website News 1 on August 30. 
					
					 Venereal diseases like syphilis are also plaguing the army. 
					
					 The military is in trouble with the epidemics spreading in addition to the ceaseless gang assaults, suicides and scandals.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Political Party, German Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian Political Party, German Body
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- A Russian political party and German body posted articles on their websites on August 25, the Day of Songun.
					 The Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation in an article titled "The Day of Songun of the DPRK" said:
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il started his Songun revolutionary leadership by visiting the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960. This marked a historic event of really great significance.
					
					 Making ceaseless tours for the Songun leadership till the last moments of his life, he developed the Korean People's Army into an invincible army and provided a sure military guarantee for the victory of the socialist cause.
					
					The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany in an article titled "Kim Jong Il, eternal sun of Songun" said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and formulated the Songun politics as the main political mode under socialism.
					
					 Kim Jong Il provided a sure guarantee for glorifying the history of the victory of the Songun revolution, foreseeing the future of the country and nation. This was his greatest feat.

articles.title: Cambodian King, Great Queen Send Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Cambodian King, Great Queen Send Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni and Cambodian Great Queen Norodom Monineath Sihanouk sent large floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh on August 29 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 The floral baskets were laid before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked in Nigeria
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked in Nigeria 
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Nigerian newspapers dedicated articles to the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership 
					 The Nigerian Observer on August 19 in an article titled "With might of Songun" said:
					
					 August 25 is not an ordinary day for the DPRK. 
					
					 On August 25, 1960 Kim Jong Il visited the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army (KPA), starting his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Since then thanks to his Songun leadership the DPRK always protected its sovereignty and dignity in the ceaseless standoff with the U.S. styling itself "the world's only superpower" for over half a century.
					
					 The statesman on August 27 in an article titled "Day of Songun in DPRK" said he inspected a lot of units of the KPA to the last moments of his life. 
					
					 He energetically led the work to strengthen the KPA into a matchless army through ceaseless long journey for Songun, the paper said, adding:
					
					 The DPRK is invincible thanks to its single-minded unity, strong in self-defence and achieving prosperity through the industrial revolution in the new century. This eye-opening reality of the DPRK would have been unthinkable without his Songun leadership exploits.

articles.title: Day of Songun Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Songun Observed in Different Countries 
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Lectures were given in Nigeria, Angola and Peru from August 18 to 24 on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 The acting chairman of the Nigerian Group for Self-Reliance Studies said in his lecture that it was an event of weighty significance that Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership over the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					
					 He stressed that Kim Jong Il provided a firm military guarantee for a victory of the cause of socialism by building the KPA into a matchless army and consolidating the military capability in every way with the KPA as its core.
					
					 The general secretary of a Peruvian league said that the current lecture helped the audience know well about the reality of the DPRK, the advantages of the Korean-style socialist system and its popular character, in particular.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The victory of socialism is sure to be won.
					
					 We should closely unite in the struggle against the oppression by capital and for social justice, progress, prosperity, well-being and democracy and learn from the example of the DPRK.
					
					 I extend solidarity to the Korean people in their just struggle against the U.S. imperialists, boss of imperialism.

articles.title: TASS Introduces Arch of Triumph in DPRK
articles.content:
TASS Introduces Arch of Triumph in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- TASS of Russia introduced the Arch of Triumph in the DPRK on August 29, conveying the news of the release of a DPRK-Russia joint stamp.
					 Noting the Russian Federation and the DPRK released a joint stamp to mark the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, it said the Arch of Triumph in Pyongyang was depicted on the stamp.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 The Arch of Triumph is located at the foot of Moran Hill in Pyongyang.
					
					 The granite-made monument is 60 meters high and 50.1 meters wide.
					
					 It is one of the monumental edifices in Pyongyang and has drawn a lot of people.
					
					 The edifice was built on the initiative and under the guidance of leader Kim Jong Il in April, 1982 on the occasion of the 70th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The President who liberated Korea by leading a protracted anti-Japanese armed struggle to a victory made a historic speech upon his triumphant return to home.
					
					 The immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Il Sung" is engraved on it.
					
					 It also bears "1925" and "1945", the years when the President embarked on the road of revolution and returned home after liberating Korea.
					
					 Mt. Paektu, the holy mountain of the revolution, is depicted on either side of the monument.
					
					 Though Kim Il Sung passed away, the Korean people is holding him in high esteem as the eternal President of the DPRK.

articles.title: Joint Performance of State Merited Chorus and Chongbong Band of DPRK Given before Full House in Russia
articles.content:
Joint Performance of State Merited Chorus and Chongbong Band of DPRK Given before Full House in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, September 3 -- The State Merited Chorus and the Chongbong Band of the DPRK on a visit to Russia gave their performance at Moskvichi Cultural Centre on Tuesday.
					 Put on the stage were songs which mesmerized the audience as they reflected the soul of Juche Korea and instilling patriotism into the minds of the Russian people. 
					
					 Among the numbers were male chorus and light music "Song of Proud Guards Units" of the DPRK and male solo and unaccompanied chorus "Vast Land Siberia" of Russia." All songs were acclaimed by the audience.
					
					 Veteran singers of the Russian Army Academic Song and Dance Ensemble Named after Alexandrov successfully presented the Russian song "Naval Port at Night" and the Korean song "My Home Village" in male duet and male solo to the accompaniment of the State Merited Chorus, truthfully representing the friendship growing strong between the peoples of the DPRK and Russia.
					
					 The joint performance deeply impressed Russian audience and evoked a livery response among them.
					
					 The performance goes on.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Marked in Syria
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Marked in Syria 
 Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- A monument to Kim Il Sung Street was erected and Kim Il Sung Park was built in Kafar Sussa District, Damascus City, Syria on the occasion of the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation.
					 Seen on the upper part of the monument where Kimilsungia, flower of the sun, is carved are letters "Kim Il Sung Street".
					
					 The monument bore letters "The great H.E. President Kim Il Sung (April 15, 1912-July 8, 1994) is the eternal leader of the Korean people and close friend of the Syrian Arab people. Kim Il Sung Street was opened to traffic on April 10, 2002 on the occasion of the 90th birth anniversary of H.E. President Kim Il Sung."
					
					 A ceremony of unveiling the monument to Kim Il Sung Street and of naming Kim Il Sung Park took place on the spot on August 31.
					
					 Present there were the director of the Higher Education Department of the Regional Leadership of the Baath Arab Socialist Party who doubles as chairman of the Syrian Arab-Korea Friendship Association, the secretary of the Damascus Provincial Committee of the Baath Arab Socialist Party, the first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates, the vice-minister of Defence, the chairman of the Revolutionary Youth Union, the vice-governor of Damascus Province and other personages of Syrian political parties, government, military, organizations and media organs and masses, the DPRK ambassador to Syria and his embassy officials.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Jang Myong Ho, DPRK ambassador to Syria, said that the monument was erected in Kim Il Sung Street in the central district of Damascus City and Kim Il Sung Park was newly built, adding that it reflected the boundless reverence of the Syrian people for him.
					
					 Fairouz Mousa, director of the Higher Education Department of the Regional Leadership of the Baath Arab Socialist Party, noted that the monument to the street and the park holding the august name of the great man was erected and named. The fact shows well the solidity of the friendly relations between the two countries the foundation of which was provided by former President Hafez Al-Assad and Kim Il Sung and carried forward by President Bashar, he added.
					
					 He stressed that the relations would be further boosted in the joint struggle for frustrating the U.S. moves.
					
					 The monument was unveiled.
					
					 The participants went round the monument and the park.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju averigua construccion de Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju averigua construccion de Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas
						
Pyongyang, 3 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, estudio en el terreno el estado de construccion del Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas.
					En el lugar de construccion, Pak estimulo a los constructores militares que logran milagros e innovaciones.
					
					En la reunion consultiva efectuada en el terreno, se tomaron medidas para asegurar perfectamente la calidad de la obra y para hacer que las unidades correspondientes suministren con satisfaccion los materiales de construccion a fin de completarla como nueva creacion monumental a ser regalada al Partido del Trabajo de Corea con motivo del 70o de la fundacion del Partido.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier Pak recorrio el Combinado de Tractores "Kum Song" y la Piscifactoria de Siluros de Pyongyang.
					
					Senalo la posicion y la importancia que ocupa el dicho combinado en realizar la mecanizacion general de la economia rural y discutio los problemas que se presentan en producir los tractores de alto caballo de fuerza y buen funcionamiento. E indico remodelar magnificamente la Piscifactoria de Siluros de Pyongyang para transmitir para siempre el amor al pueblo del Partido.

articles.title: CRPP advierte a autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
CRPP advierte a autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 3 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Durante su visita a ultramar, la mandataria surcoreana dijo irrazonablemente que el incidente ocurrido recientemente en la zona desmilitarizada fuera "provocacion del Norte" y que "expresa agradecimiento al papel constructivo" de alguien.
					Al respecto, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) respondio el dia 3 a la ACNC como sigue:
					
					Actualmente, todos los connacionales consideran como buena suerte lo que se controlo la crisis muy tirante en el umbral del  choque armado entre el Norte y el Sur y desean unanimemente que se ejecute sinceramente la informacion conjunta del contacto urgente de alto rango Norte-Sur y se prepare nuevo ambiente de la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas y la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Segun el presente acuerdo Norte-Sur, se preve efectuarse el dia 7 de este mes el contacto practico de la cruz roja Norte-Sur para el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados y se preparan los programas proximos para la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Sin embargo, las autoridades surcoreanas siguen soltando en estos dias los disparates opuestos a este ambiente y crean de nuevo la complicacion en las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					En particular, durante su gira a ultramar, la mandataria surcoreana tergiverso el dia 2 la verdad de la crisis creada hace poco soltando los disparates difamantes a su contraparte y carentes de elemental juicio politico de que "el Norte provoco en la zona desmilitarizada y puede agravar la tension en cualquier tiempo" y mencionando hasta el "papel constructivo" de alguien.
					
					Como todo el mundo estima unanimemente, nosotros presentamos, con la firme posicion independiente y con iniciativa, el contacto urgente de alto rango Norte-Sur al reflejar el interes fundamental y el anhelo de toda la nacion y con muchos esfuerzos sinceros, preparamos la oportunidad de cambio dramatico por la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Sin embargo, la mandataria surcoreana tergiversa tal hecho hasta en el ultramar lanzando con el alma negra tal o cual disparates y adulando a alguien, lo que muestra patentemente que de boca ella habla de la reconciliacion y cooperacion, pero de hecho persigue solo la confrontacion fratricida bajo el amparo de alguien.
					
					Es problematico que en el nivel inferior se lanzan los disparates erroneos y hasta la mandataria dice las palabras irresponsables opuestas al espiritu del acuerdo N-S y a la corriente de la epoca, lo que dificulta conjeturar siquiera los inmediatos programas de relaciones N-S.
					
					Francamente dicho, las actuales relaciones intercoreanas son iguales a un hielo delgado que pudiera romperse en cualquier momento.
					
					Por eso, la RPDC aconsejo a las autoridades surcoreanas que mantengan y controlen bien las relaciones N-S dirigidas dificilmente a la reconciliacion y relajacion. Tambien subrayo la necesidad de mantener la vigilancia y prestar peculiar atencion a las fuerzas que no aplauden la mejora de  relaciones N-S.
					
					Si la mandataria surcoreana tiene la basica vision politica, tendra que hablar y actuar con prudencia para no destruir las relaciones intercoreanas en esta circunstancia tan aguda.
					
					Ella debe tener presente que la fuerza capaz de promover el mejoramiento de relaciones intercoreanas y defender la paz de la Peninsula Coreana, la tiene no la fuerza extranjera sino nuestra nacion.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas siguen lanzando los disparates muy difamantes a su contraparte llevando al exterior los asuntos internos de la nacion, las relaciones intercoreanas volveran a caer en el circulo vicioso de  confrontacion.
					
					Abrirse el camino de la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas mediante la ejecucion sustancial del acuerdo N-S preparado a duras penas o llevarse otra vez a la extremidad la grave situacion depende enteramente de la postura de las autoridades surcoreanas.

articles.title: Publicados nuevos sellos en RPDC
articles.content:
Publicados nuevos sellos en RPDC
						
Pyongyang, 3 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La Direccion Estatal de Sellos de Corea dio a luz los sellos (un papel enterizo de pequeno tamano y el otro individual) que reflejan la nueva historia del mar de gran cosecha.
					En el primer papel, se ve la foto del Mariscal Kim Jong Un estando de pie con amplia sonrisa frente al descargadero de pescados.
					
					En el segundo se distinguen los barcos pesqueros Tanphung que logran gran cosecha de pescados en el mar extenso.
					
					En la actualidad, la RPDC se esfuerza por reinar en todo el pais el intenso olor del mar socialista.
